review_blob: Overall a good beer, drinks better warmer as it allows the sweeter flavors out. Drunk cold its really smooth but tastes more like a pilsen than a oktoberfest. Either way its a really beer.

Aroma is balanced, not too strong or weak, and smells nice, like citrus and slightly piney. Appearance is golden orange. Decently clear, not much lacing. Tastes of grapefruits, bitter, but not overly. Spicy on the palate, slightly unpleasant aftertaste in the back of the palate. Overall its good IPA, nothing special though.

Average Appearance-Pours hazy gold, with a short head retention. Aroma-strong, though I am not sure I like the smell, strong almost soapy notes(possibly a strong yeast smell?). Flavor- Fantastic, absolutely love it. Palate-exceptional, well carbonated. Drinks as well as any beer Ive had. No foul tastes. This beer reminds me of why I feel in love with craft brews. They have outstanding flavor.
Was a nice golden color with good spicy flavors. one of the better witbeers that I have had. very surprised as I do not tend to like Wits much. Good summertime brew.

Pours amber/golden and slightly hazy. Good head retention and some lacing on the sides. Not like a lot of stronger A.P.As which have strong aromas, this one has subtle, but good aroma. Good malt/hop balance. Feels smooth on the palate, no foul aftertastes and does not leave a dry tinge like other APAs. Overall, very solid pale ale, though, I prefer other stronger pale ales. 3.4 for good appearance, balanced taste, and good feel on the palate.
